Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics are on a 3-game Western road trip and have won the first two games against the Timberwolves and Rockets.
The Thunder are in first place in the West and have a 14-game win streak.
The Thunder made several key moves in the offseason, including signing Isaiah Hartenstein and trading for Alex Caruso.
Kristaps Porzingis returned to the starting lineup for the Celtics in their last game against the Rockets after missing 4 straight games with a sprained ankle.
Al Horford sat out the Celtics' last game for rest but is expected to return for this game.
Jalen Brown has missed the Celtics' last two games with a shoulder strain and is questionable for this game.
Key Match Events: This game may be a preview of the NBA Finals.
The teams split the series 1-1 the last two seasons with each team winning on their home court.
The Celtics are 79-66 overall all time against the Thunder and they are 39-38 in games played on the road.
Others: The game will be televised on NBA-TV, NBCSB, and 98.5 Sports Hub, WWLS/WKY, Sirius XM.
The game will take place at Paycom Center.
The Celtics remain 2nd in the East, 4.5 games behind the first place Cleveland Cavaliers.
The Thunder are 6.5 games ahead of 2nd place Memphis and 7 ahead of 3rd place Houston.
The Thunder are 15-2 at home and they are 10-0 in their last 10 games.
The Thunder are 10-0 against Eastern Conference opponents and they currently have a 14-game win streak.
